meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Andy King Amanda Bruchs Colby Potter Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7124.

div.div: Some of Alex Trebek's audio was re-recorded when his voice recovered.

td.p: Andy King, a high school principal originally from Chatham Center, New York
Amanda Bruchs, an attorney from Silver Spring, Maryland
Colby Potter, a policy analyst originally from Denver, Colorado (whose 1-day cash winnings total $200)

tr.td: (Alex: And the "Y" is immediately before the letter "E" in each correct response.)
(Kelly: Some dead ends and some early versions of standard modern instruments from Cleveland's Dittrick Medical History Center.)

a defibrillator

Andy
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_5', 'clue_J_6_5_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Dittrick Medical History Center in Cleveland, OH.) Sometimes during surgery, the heart convulses, loses rhythm & stops pumping blood; Cleveland surgeon Claude Beck used cardiac massage & applied electrical current directly to the heart to reverse the phenomenon using this device; those techniques led him to develop CPR')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Dittrick Medical History Center in Cleveland, OH.) Sometimes during surgery, the heart convulses, loses rhythm & stops pumping blood; Cleveland surgeon Claude Beck used cardiac massage & applied electrical current directly to the heart to reverse the phenomenon using this device; those techniques led him to develop CPR

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '
ColbyWho are the AZ Diamondbacks?
$4,197

$4,000
the Arizona Diamondbacks')
